question.text: A vehicle pulls out in front of you at a junction. What should you do?

explanation.text: Try to be ready for the unexpected. Plan ahead and learn to anticipate hazards. You’ll then give yourself more time to react to any problems that might occur. Be tolerant of the behaviour of other road users who don’t behave correctly.

answer.text: Swerve past it and sound your horn
Flash your headlights and drive up close behind
Slow down and be ready to stop
